issues.description: The template's ArrayHelpers class defines a method named appendElement(T[] array, T element) but the template's Stock and other classes call ArrayHelpers.addElementToArray(...). This name/signature mismatch causes a compile-time error and prevents students from using the provided helper methods as intended. The solution repository shows the helper method named addElementToArray, so the template is inconsistent within itself (ArrayHelpers vs. Stock usage).
issues.suggested_fix: Make the helper method name consistent. Either rename the method in template_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/ArrayHelpers.java from appendElement(...) to addElementToArray(...) (matching Stock.java and the solution), or update Stock.java (and any other callers) to call appendElement(...). Prefer renaming ArrayHelpers.appendElement to addElementToArray to match the rest of the code and the provided solution.

issues.description: The ArrayHelpers method name is inconsistent across artifacts: the template repository's ArrayHelpers defines appendElement(...), while other template files (Stock.java) call ArrayHelpers.addElementToArray(...). The solution repository uses addElementToArray(...). This mismatch means students starting from the template will see a helper method named appendElement but other classes expect addElementToArray (causing compilation errors and confusion). It is unclear which name students should use, increasing extraneous cognitive load and blocking straightforward mapping from problem requirements to the provided code.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the helper method name across artifacts. Rename the template ArrayHelpers.appendElement(...) to addElementToArray(...) (matching Stock.java usage and the solution), or alternatively change calls in Stock.java to use appendElement(...). The preferred fix is to standardize on addElementToArray(...) so the template code (Stock.java) and the solution remain consistent and students have a single clear API to use.
